patient_info: Bilateral ptosis,EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation,Fatigable weakness,Upper limb muscle weakness,Difficulty climbing stairs,Difficulty standing,EMG: repetitive nerve stimulation abnormality,Favorable response of weakness to acetylcholine esterase inhibitors,Abnormal levator palpebrae superioris morphology
golden_diagnosis: 全身型重症肌无力/Generalized myasthenia gravis; GMG/Myasthenia gravis/Myasthenia gravis,全身型重症肌无力/Generalized myasthenia gravis; GMG/Myasthenia gravis/Myasthenia gravis,全身型重症肌无力/Generalized myasthenia gravis; GMG/Myasthenia gravis/Myasthenia gravis
predict_diagnosis:
1. Myasthenia Gravis
2. Lambert-Eaton Myasthenic Syndrome (LEMS)
3. Progressive External Ophthalmoplegia (PEO)
4. Inflammatory Myopathies (e.g., Polymyositis, Dermatomyositis)
5. Neuromyotonia (NM)
6. Hereditary Titinopathies (e.g., Limb-girdle Muscular Dystrophy, Facioscapulohumeral Muscular Dystrophy)
7. Congenital Muscular Dystrophy (CMD)
8. Metabolic Myopathies (e.g., McArdle's Disease, Glycogen Storage Disease Type II)
9. Autoimmune Neuromuscular Diseases (e.g., Autoimmune Myasthenia Gravis, Autoimmune Neuromyotonia)
10. Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA)

Please provide a detailed explanation for each diagnosis, including the underlying pathophysiology, clinical features, and diagnostic tests used to support the diagnosis.
